is hard zoning it's enforcementbased zoning so what that means is that if you
have a hard zoning table with three nodes the hard zoning rule will
basically say these three nodes have access to each other and I will go ahead and give them route information to each
other so the three nodes are A B and C i will tell A how to get to B and C and I will tell B how to get to A and C and so
on and so on i will give them that route information so they know where to go and
I'm going to look to make sure they actually go where they're supposed to go so once A tries to access C I'm going to
look at that request and say "Okay A yes you have access to C and I gave you route information so you know how to get
there go ahead move along everything's okay." Hard zoning is very good hard zoning is very good soft zoning is
information based zoning what soft zoning does is basically again you have one zone and you have three nodes A B
and C again soft zoning will give route information to A to get to B and C and B
to get to A and C and so on and so on but if node A wants to access a
different node in a different zone soft zoning will not give that route to that node but if that node
knows how to get there can set a static route soft zoning won't deny it it will
just let it go through so what does that mean well soft
zoning basically doesn't restrict anything all it does is say "Hey I'm not
going to tell you how to get there but if you know how to get there then go right ahead i could care less." It's
